lines.content: Zero is a task management chatbot that helps you manage your to-do lists efficiently through a command-line interface or a GUI. It allows you to add, delete, mark tasks as done, snooze deadlines, and more.

Welcome to Zero, your personal task management assistant! Zero helps you keep track of your tasks with ease. Whether you prefer using a command-line interface or a graphical user interface, Zero has got you covered.
- Adds a to-do task with the specified description.
- Displays: `Got it. I've added this task: [T][ ] read book`
Add a task with a specific deadline.
- Adds a deadline task with the specified description and due date.
- Displays: `Got it. I've added this task: [D][ ] return book (by: 1 SEPTEMBER 2024)`
Add an event with a start and end time.
- **Command Structure:** `event <description> /from <start date and time> /to <end date and time>`
- Adds an event task with the specified description, start, and end times.
- Displays: `Got it. I've added this task: [E][ ] project meeting (from: 1 SEPTEMBER 2024 to: 1 SEPTEMBER 2024)`
- Marks the specified task as done.
- Displays: `Nice! I've marked this task as done: [T][X] study`
Unmark a task to indicate it is not done.
- Displays: `OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: [T][ ] study`
- Snoozes the deadline of the specified task.
- Displays: `Nice! I've postponed this task: [D][ ] return book (by: 3 NOVEMBER 2020)`
Remove a task from the list.
- Deletes the specified task from the list.
- Displays: `Noted. I've removed this task: [E][ ] book fair (from: 24 NOVEMBER 2020 to: 24 DECEMBER 2020)`
View all tasks in your list.
- **Expected Output:** Lists all tasks containing the specified keyword.
| **Adding Events**           | `event <description> /from <start date and time> /to <end date and time>` | `event project meeting /from 2024-09-01 1400 /to 2024-09-01 1600` |

Zero is a task management chatbot that helps you manage your to-do lists efficiently through a command-line interface or a GUI. It allows you to add, delete, mark tasks as done, snooze deadlines, and more.

Welcome to Zero, your personal task management assistant! Zero helps you keep track of your tasks with ease. Whether you prefer using a command-line interface or a graphical user interface, Zero has got you covered.
- Adds a to-do task with the specified description.
- Displays: `Got it. I've added this task: [T][ ] read book`
Add a task with a specific deadline.
- Adds a deadline task with the specified description and due date.
- Displays: `Got it. I've added this task: [D][ ] return book (by: 1 SEPTEMBER 2024)`
Add an event with a start and end time.
- **Command Structure:** `event <description> /from <start date and time> /to <end date and time>`
- Adds an event task with the specified description, start, and end times.
- Displays: `Got it. I've added this task: [E][ ] project meeting (from: 1 SEPTEMBER 2024 to: 1 SEPTEMBER 2024)`
- Marks the specified task as done.
- Displays: `Nice! I've marked this task as done: [T][X] study`
Unmark a task to indicate it is not done.
- Displays: `OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: [T][ ] study`
- Snoozes the deadline of the specified task.
- Displays: `Nice! I've postponed this task: [D][ ] return book (by: 3 NOVEMBER 2020)`
Remove a task from the list.
- Deletes the specified task from the list.
- Displays: `Noted. I've removed this task: [E][ ] book fair (from: 24 NOVEMBER 2020 to: 24 DECEMBER 2020)`
View all tasks in your list.
- **Expected Output:** Lists all tasks containing the specified keyword.
| **Adding Events**           | `event <description> /from <start date and time> /to <end date and time>` | `event project meeting /from 2024-09-01 1400 /to 2024-09-01 1600` |

* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Zero's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* The {@code Zero} class is the main class for the Zero application.
* It handles the initialisation of the necessary components and manages the application's main loop.
* Initialises the UI, storage, and task list components. If there is an error loading the tasks from the file,
* a new empty task list is created, and the error is displayed via the UI.
* Starts the main loop of the Zero application.
* Continuously reads user commands, processes them using the {@code Parser}, updates the task list,
* and saves the tasks to the file. The loop terminates when the user issues a command to exit.
* The main entry point of the Zero application.
* Initialises the file path to the stored information
* @param args The first line can be used to specify the file path of the storage
* The {@code Deadline} class represents a task that needs to be completed by a specific date and time.
* It is a subclass of {@code Task} and adds a {@code LocalDateTime} field to store the deadline.
* Constructs a {@code Deadline} task with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param byDate The date and time by which the task must be completed.
* Returns the status icon of the task, inherited from the {@code Task} class.
* @return A string representing whether the task is done or not.
* Snoozes the deadline by extending the due date by one day.
* This updates the {@code byDate} field to reflect the new deadline.
* Converts the {@code Deadline} task to a formatted string for saving to file.
* @return A string representation of the {@code Deadline} task for file storage.
* Returns a string representation of the {@code Deadline} task, including its deadline.
* @return A string in the format [D][status] description (by: day month year).
* The {@code Event} class represents a task that occurs within a specific time frame.
* It is a subclass of {@code Task} and adds two {@code LocalDateTime} fields to store the start (from)
* Constructs an {@code Event} task with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param fromDate The starting date and time of the event.
* @param toYear The ending date and time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime fromDate, LocalDateTime toYear) {

* Returns a string representation of the {@code Event} task, including its start and end times.
* @return A string in the format [E][status] description (from: day month year to: day month year).
* The {@code Task} class represents a task with a description and a completion status.
* It provides methods to mark the task as done or not done, retrieve the task's status,
* and format the task's details for display or storage.
* Mainly used as a super class for other tasks with more information.
* Constructs a {@code Task} with the specified description. The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task, an "X" if the task is done, or a space if it is not done.
* @return A string representing the task's status.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // Mark done tasks with X

* Returns "1" if the task is done, or "0" if it is not done.
* @return A string representing whether the task is done.
* Formats the task's description for storage.
* @return A string representing the task in a format suitable for file storage.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status icon and description.
* @return A string in the format "[status] description".

* It provides methods to add, delete, and retrieve tasks, as well as to validate task indices.
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} with the specified list of tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task The task to be added.

public Task deleteTask(int index) throws ZeroException {

public String showTaskDeleted(Task task, int taskCount) {

* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for parsing user commands and executing the corresponding operations
* on the task list. It interprets commands like adding tasks, marking tasks as done, deleting tasks, and more.
* Parses the full command entered by the user and executes the corresponding operation.
* @param fullCommand The complete command entered by the user.

* @throws ZeroException if the command is not recognized or fails to execute.
public static String parseCommand(String fullCommand, TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {
